member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.Table.CloudTableClient
member.summary: Provides a client-side logical representation of the Microsoft Azure Table service. This client is used to configure and execute requests against the Table service.
member.remarks: The CloudTableClient object encapsulates the base URI for the Table service. If the service client will be used for authenticated access, it also encapsulates the credentials for accessing the storage account.
member.summary: Provides a client-side logical representation of the Microsoft Azure Table Service. This client is used to configure and execute requests against the Table Service.
member.remarks: The service client encapsulates the endpoint or endpoints for the Table service. If the service client will be used for authenticated access, it also encapsulates the credentials for accessing the storage account.
member.summary: Provides a client-side logical representation of the Microsoft Azure Table Service. This client is used to configure and execute requests against the Table Service.
member.remarks: The service client encapsulates the endpoint or endpoints for the Table service. If the service client will be used for authenticated access, it also encapsulates the credentials for accessing the storage account.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.Table.ITableEntity
member.summary: An interface required for table entity types. The interface declares getter and setter methods for the mandatory entity properties, and and methods for serialization and de-serialization of all entity properties using a property dictionary. Create classes implementing to customize property storage, retrieval, serialization and de-serialization, and to provide additional custom logic for a table entity.

remarks.para: The storage client library includes two implementations of that provide for simple property access and serialization:

implements and provides a simple property dictionary to store and retrieve properties. Use a for simple access to entity properties when only a subset of properties are returned (for example, by a select clause in a query), or for scenarios where your query can return multiple entity types with different properties. You can also use this type to perform bulk table updates of heterogeneous entities without losing property information.

is an implementation of that uses reflection-based serialization and de-serialization behavior in its and methods. -derived classes with methods that follow a convention for types and naming are serialized and deserialized automatically. -derived classes must also provide a get-able and set-able public property of a type that is supported by the Microsoft Azure Table service.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.Table.TableBatchOperation
member.summary: Represents a batch operation on a table.

remarks.para: A batch operation is a collection of table operations which are executed by the Storage Service REST API as a single atomic operation, by invoking an Entity Group Transaction.

A batch operation may contain up to 100 individual table operations, with the requirement that each operation entity must have same partition key. A batch with a retrieve operation cannot contain any other operations. Note that the total payload of a batch operation is limited to 4MB.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.Table.TableEntityAdapter`1.WriteEntity(Microsoft.Azure.Storage.OperationContext)
member.summary: Serializes the of property names mapped to data values from the property.
member.param: An object that represents the context for the current operation.
member.returns: An object that maps string property names to typed values created by serializing this table entity instance.
member.remarks:
If is a simple POCO object with simple properties (primitive types, string, byte[], ...), method will create objects using these properties.
Ie. A simple POCO object A with properties of B and C with this structure A->B, A->C, will be converted to key value pairs of {"B", EntityProperty(B)}, {"C", EntityProperty(C)}.
If has complex properties (and potentially these properties having complex properties of their own), method will flatten first.
Ie. An object A with a simple property of B and complex properties of C and D which have their own properties of E and F with this structure A->B, A->C->E and A->D->F, will be flattened to key value pairs of:
{"B", EntityProperty(B)}, {"C_E", EntityProperty(E)} and {"D_F", EntityProperty(F)}.
For each key value pair:
1. The key is composed by appending the names of the properties visited from root (A) to end node property (E or F) delimited by "_".
2. The value is the object, instantiated by the value of the end node property.
All key value pairs will be stored in the returned .
method recomposes the original object (POCO or complex) using the returned by this method and store it in property.
Properties that are marked with in the object will be ignored and not processed by this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.Table.TableRequestOptions.SessionToken
member.summary: Gets or sets the token for use with session consistency in the Azure Cosmos DB service. Only supported in Direct Mode.
member.value: The token for use with session consistency.
member.remarks:
One of the for Azure Cosmos DB is Session.
When working with Session consistency, each new write request to Azure Cosmos DB is assigned a new SessionToken. The will use this token internally with each read/query request to ensure that the set consistency level is maintained.
In some scenarios you need to manage this Session yourself; Consider a web application with multiple nodes, each node will have its own instance of If you wanted these nodes to participate in the same session (to be able read your own writes consistently across web tiers) you would have to send the SessionToken from one of the write action on one node to the client tier, using a cookie or some other mechanism, and have that token flow back to the web tier for subsequent reads. If you are using a round-robin load balancer which does not maintain session affinity between requests, such as the Azure Load Balancer, the read could potentially land on a different node to the write request, where the session was created.
If you do not flow the Azure Cosmos DB SessionToken across as described above you could end up with inconsistent read results for a period of time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.Table.TableRequestOptions.TableQueryMaxItemCount
member.summary: Configure the maximum number of items returned per table query in a single round trip.
member.value: The maximum number of items to be returned in a query operation. Default is 1000.
member.remarks: -1 lets Azure Cosmos DB dynamically determine the value at runtime. Only supported in Direct Mode.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.Table.TableRequestOptions.TableQueryEnableScan
member.summary: Get or set the option to run a scan when a filter cannot use the index for any filter. Default is false. Only supported in Direct Mode.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.Table.TableRequestOptions.TableQueryMaxDegreeOfParallelism
member.summary: Gets or sets the degree of parallelism for execution of a cross-partition query. 0 is serial with no pre-fetching, 1 is serial with pre-fetching, and higher values increase the rate of parallelism. Default is -1, which lets Azure Cosmos DB dynamically determine the value at runtime.
member.value: The maximum number of concurrent operations during parallel execution. Defaults to -1.
member.remarks: 0 is serial with no pre-fetching, 1 is serial with pre-fetching, and higher values increase the rate of parallelism. -1 lets Azure Cosmos DB dynamically determine the value at runtime. Only supported in Direct Mode.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.Table.TableRequestOptions.TableQueryContinuationTokenLimitInKb
member.summary: Get or set the length of continuation token in the query response. Valid values are >= 0.
member.value: The token length in kilobytes. Only supported in Direct Mode.

member.summary: Represents an encryption policy for performing envelope encryption/decryption of entities in Azure tables.

member.summary: An object of type that is used to wrap/unwrap the content key during encryption.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.Table.TableEncryptionPolicy.KeyResolver
member.summary: Gets or sets the key resolver used to select the correct key for decrypting existing table entities.
member.value: A resolver that returns an , given a key ID.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.Table.TableEncryptionPolicy.#ctor(Microsoft.Azure.KeyVault.Core.IKey,Microsoft.Azure.KeyVault.Core.IKeyResolver)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified key and resolver.
member.param: An object of type that is used to wrap/unwrap the content encryption key.
The key resolver used to select the correct key for decrypting existing table entities.
member.remarks:
If the generated policy is to be used for encryption, users are expected to provide a key at the minimum. The absence of key will cause an exception to be thrown during encryption.
If the generated policy is intended to be used for decryption, users can provide a key resolver. The client library will:
1. Invoke the key resolver, if specified, to get the key.
2. If resolver is not specified but a key is specified, the client library will match the key ID against the key and use the key.

member.summary: Use direct mode when connecting to Azure Cosmos DB service.

member.remarks: For more information, see Connection policy: Use the TCP protocol.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.Table.TableConnectionPolicy.UserAgentSuffix
member.summary: A suffix to be added to the default user-agent for the Azure Cosmos DB service.
member.remarks: Setting this property after sending any request won't have any effect.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.Table.TableConnectionPolicy.PreferredLocations
member.summary: Gets and sets the preferred locations (regions) for geo-replicated database accounts in the Azure Cosmos DB service. For example, "East US" as the preferred location.

remarks.para: When is true and the value of this property is non-empty, the SDK uses the locations in the collection in the order they are specified to perform operations, otherwise if the value of this property is not specified, the SDK uses the write region as the preferred location for all operations.
If is set to false, the value of this property is ignored.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.Table.TableConnectionPolicy.EnableEndpointDiscovery
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag to enable endpoint discovery for geo-replicated database accounts in the Azure Cosmos DB service.
member.remarks: When the value of this property is true, the SDK will automatically discover the current write and read regions to ensure requests are sent to the correct region based on the regions specified in the property. Default value is true indicating endpoint discovery is enabled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.Table.TableConnectionPolicy.MaxConnectionLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of concurrent connections allowed for the target service endpoint in the Azure Cosmos DB service.
member.remarks: This setting is only applicable in Gateway mode.
member.value: Default value is 50.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.Table.TableConnectionPolicy.MaxRetryAttemptsOnThrottledRequests
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of retries in the case where the request fails because the Azure Cosmos DB service has applied rate limiting on the client.
member.value: The default value is 9. This means in the case where the request is rate limited, the same request will be issued for a maximum of 10 times to the server before an error is returned to the application. If the value of this property is set to 0, there will be no automatic retry on rate limiting requests from the client and the exception needs to handled at the application level.

remarks.para: When a client is sending requests faster than the allowed rate, the service will return HttpStatusCode 429 (Too Many Request) to rate limit the client. The current implementation in the SDK will then wait for the amount of time the service tells it to wait and retry after the time has elapsed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.Table.TableConnectionPolicy.MaxRetryWaitTimeInSeconds
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum retry time in seconds for the Azure Cosmos DB service.
member.value: The default value is 30 seconds.

remarks.para: When a request fails due to a rate limiting error, the service sends back a response that contains a value indicating the client should not retry before the time period has elapsed. This property allows the application to set a maximum wait time for all retry attempts. If the cumulative wait time exceeds the this value, the client will stop retrying and return the error to the application.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.Table.TableConnectionPolicy.UseMultipleWriteLocations
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag to enable writes on any locations (regions) for geo-replicated database accounts in the Azure Cosmos DB service.
member.remarks: When the value of this property is true, the SDK will direct write operations to available writable locations of geo-replicated database account. Writable locations are ordered by property. Setting the property value to true has no effect until the database account is enabled for multiple write locations. Default value is false indicating that writes are only directed to first region in property.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.ConsistencyLevel
member.summary: These are the consistency levels supported by the Azure Cosmos DB service.
member.remarks: The requested Consistency Level must match or be weaker than that provisioned for the database account. For more information on consistency levels, please see http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-consistency-levels/" Consistency Levels article.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.ConsistencyLevel.Strong
member.summary: Strong Consistency guarantees that read operations always return the value that was last written.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.ConsistencyLevel.BoundedStaleness
member.summary: Bounded Staleness guarantees that reads are not too out-of-date. This can be configured based on number of operations (MaxStalenessPrefix) or time (MaxStalenessIntervalInSeconds). For more information on MaxStalenessPrefix and MaxStalenessIntervalInSeconds, please see .

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.ConsistencyLevel.Session
member.summary: Session Consistency guarantees monotonic reads (you never read old data, then new, then old again), monotonic writes (writes are ordered) and read your writes (your writes are immediately visible to your reads) within any single session.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.ConsistencyLevel.Eventual
member.summary: Eventual Consistency guarantees that reads will return a subset of writes. All writes will be eventually be available for reads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.ConsistencyLevel.ConsistentPrefix
member.summary: ConsistentPrefix Consistency guarantees that reads will return some prefix of all writes with no gaps. All writes will be eventually be available for reads.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.IndexingMode
member.summary: Specifies the supported indexing modes in the Azure Cosmos DB service.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.IndexingMode.Consistent
member.summary: Index is updated synchronously with a create, update or delete operation.
member.remarks:
With consistent indexing, query consistency is the same as the default consistency level for the database account. The index is always kept up to date with the data.
The default IndexingMode is Consistent.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.IndexingMode.Lazy
member.summary: Index is updated asynchronously with respect to a create, update or delete operation.
member.remarks:
With lazy indexing, queries are eventually consistent. The index is updated when the collection is operating below full throughput capacity (Request units per second).
Write operations will consume fewer request units (RequestCharge) at the time of write.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.IndexingMode.None
member.summary: No index is provided.
member.remarks: Setting IndexingMode to "None" drops the index. Use this if you don't want to maintain the index for a document collection, to save the storage cost or improve the write throughput. Your queries will degenerate to scans of the entire collection.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.Tables.SharedFiles.EntityTranslator.JsonSerializerSettings
member.summary:
Default Json serialization settings used internally for entity conversions and for persisting documents.
To prevent user configured JsonConvert.DefaultSettings from affecting Table entity serialization, we must explicitly specify our own serialization settings. Places where it is used: - When we need to do serialization outside of DocumentClient, which happens in a few places as part of entity conversion. - Passed to DocumentClient, to ensure DocumentClient always use our settings.
Due to current inconsistencies in DocumentClient on how JsonConvert.DefaultSettings is used (In some cases it is entirely ignored, while other cases it is merged with user settings), we must explicitly specify properties that we care about, such as the ContractResolver, so that our settings take precedence.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.Tables.SharedFiles.EntityTranslator.JsonSerializer
member.summary: JsonSerializer used internally for Entity conversions. This serializer must not use any default serialization settings configured by user code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.Tables.SharedFiles.HexUtilities.HexToBytes(System.String)
member.summary: Parses hexadecimal strings the form '1234abcd' or '0x9876fedb' into an array of bytes.
member.remarks: We use a bit of custom code to avoid thrashing the heap with temp strings when using Convert.ToByte(hex.Substring(n, 2)). This method only parses an even number of hexadecimal digits; any odd-length hex string is parsed leaving the last character un-parsed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.CosmosDB.Tables.SharedFiles.HexUtilities.BytesToHex(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Byte})
member.summary: Converts the provided bytes into a hexadecimal string of the form '1234abcd'.
